results.title: 700 Million Faces
results.creator_credit: Ian Austin, Dennis Porter and East Coast Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hidden India Series”.
India is a land of contradictions. Mrs. Ghandi discusses in an in-depth yet light-hearted and often amusing interview, India’s contemporary and greatly diversified lifestyles.

results.title: Might, majesty and mysticism
results.creator_credit: Ian Austin, Dennis Porter and East Coast Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hidden India Series”.
India is synonymous with mysticism and this film goes on to explore the many incredible facets of this way of life - and death. Many people from around the world are flocking to India, not as tourists, not to see the might and majesty (of breathtaking architecture that is)… They come to find themselves through the teachings of the gurus, the powerful holy men. Might and majesty in the guise of mysticism has returned to India.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Austin, Dennis Porter and East Coast Productions

results.title: Humphrey in the snow
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Here’s Humphrey”.
Join Humphrey on his first visit to the snow where he learns to ski, goes for a ride on a skiddoo, makes a model reindeer with Jodie and plays with snowballs. Humphrey in the snow will delight young children as it is a program filled with fun, games and excitement.

results.title: Risk factors
results.creator_credit: Roger Hudson, Jim Dale, National Heart Foundation of Australia, Suatu Film Management and Mediacast
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Help yourself to health”.
Focuses on the main risk factors in coronary heart disease: prolonged high blood pressure, smoking, excessive fat in diet leading to elevated blood cholesterol levels.

results.title: The Heart
results.creator_credit: Roger Hudson, Jim Dale, National Heart Foundation of Australia, Suatu Film Management and Mediacast
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Help yourself to health”.
The human heart is a remarkable pump, averaging 72 beats a minute, pumping 7,000 litres of blood every day. Medical specialists explain the anatomy and physiology of the heart, the roles played by its valves and chambers as well as the electrical system which regulates the contraction of the heart muscle.

group_works.creator_credit: Scottish Health Education Unit and Sidhartha Films

results.title: Confusion: diagnosis and management
results.creator_credit: Scottish Health Education Unit and Sidhartha Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Health education and the elderly”.
One in a series about techniques for the management and treatment of confusion in the elderly. This episode looks in some detail, at the various causes of acute confusion, outlining the basic principles of treatment.

results.title: Correcting
results.creator_credit: Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Heart of the Dragon”.
This program follows the trial of Nie Chengying, accused of stealing from her neighbour, to show the legal system at work in China. The legal system not only aims to punish and protect society, but also seeks to restore the social harmony which has been disturbed by the crime. Also explores the social pressures at work in the new consumer society which may cause a person to commit a crime.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Montagnon, Alasdair Clayre, Patrick Lui and Nigel Houghton
